A group of porcupines is called a 'prickle.'
Wombat poop is cube-shaped to prevent it from rolling away.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on all Earth's beaches.
Sloths can take up to a month to digest a single leaf.
Koalas have fingerprints that are nearly identical to human fingerprints.
The shortest commercial flight in the world is just 1.7 miles long and lasts about 90 seconds.
The longest word in the English language has 189,819 letters and takes over three hours to pronounce.
Sharks have been around longer than trees.
The wood frog can hold its pee for up to eight months to survive the winter.
A blue whale's heart is so large that a human could swim through its arteries.
Ravens are capable of learning and mimicking human speech.
The Mona Lisa has no eyebrows because it was the fashion in Renaissance Florence to shave them off.
A single strand of spaghetti is called a 'spaghetto.'
The moon has moonquakes, similar to earthquakes on Earth.
A group of jellyfish is called a 'smack.'
Hot water freezes faster than cold water, known as the Mpemba effect.
You can't hum while holding your nose closed.
Pineapples take about two years to grow and reach their full size.
Octopuses have blue blood due to a copper-rich protein called hemocyanin.
The inventor of the frisbee was turned into a frisbee after he died.
